alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 12:23AM MST until September 13 at 1:45AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in south central Arizona, Maricopa. In southeast Arizona, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated another round of heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving through the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Verde River, Bulldog Wash, Indian Bend Wash and Salt River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Phoenix, Mesa, Scottsdale, Tempe, Apache Junction, Paradise Valley, Falcon Field Airport, Granite Reef Dam, Salt River Indian Community, Usery Mountain Park, Downtown Scottsdale, Papago Park and Camelback Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
